definition: all black, no daylight (idiom); a world without justice
dark/gloomy/hidden/secret/muddled/obscure/in the dark
not to have/no/none/not/to lack/un-/-less
day/sky/heaven
abbr. for 日本[Ri4 ben3], Japan
sun/day/date, day of the month

sentences.english: Writing, is to complete darkness to suicide.
sentences.chinese: 寫作，是以場暗無天日的自殺。

sentences.english: Like a complete darkness feelings, the end of not half sunshine.
sentences.chinese: 就像一段暗無天日的感情，終見不得半分陽光。

sentences.english: This means that the far side of the planet is constantly in darkness.
sentences.chinese: 這也意味着它的另一面永遠暗無天日。

sentences.english: These years that I have been in love have been the darkest days of my life.
sentences.chinese: 這些被愛情左右的歲月，是我人生最暗無天日的日子。

sentences.english: The narrow streets were darkened with the high towers of the nobles.
sentences.chinese: 這些狹窄的街巷被貴族家庭的高塔遮得暗無天日。

sentences.english: The old society was an abyss of darkness.

definition: after the calamity, renewed life (idiom); new lease of life
no way out/nowhere to go/trapped beyond hope of rescue/painted into a corner
lit. to return the jade annulus to Zhao (idiom); fig. to return something intact to its rightful owner
to be buried in a horse hide (idiom)/to give one's life on the battlefield
words still ringing in one's ears (idiom)
to die (idiom)/to breathe one's last/to give up the ghost
to be drowned (figurative and literal)
time flies (idiom)
to get rid of the old to bring in the new (idiom); to innovate
dejected/disheartened/listless
knell
rotten
red in the face/extremely angry
seize every minute and second (idiom); not a minute to lose/every moment counts
fight a battle of words/cross verbal swords
dejected/despondent/depressed
